title: Util
content: On this page Util Show Private

title: getElementResult​
content: </> type getElementResult = { id: number, score: number, tieBreaker: number, rank: number, extra: {} }

title: updateElementResult​
content: </> type updateElementResult = { id: number, prevRank: number, newRank: number, prevScore: number, newScore: number, shiftedBoundaries: {shiftedBoundary} }

title: shiftedBoundary​
content: </> type shiftedBoundary = { id: number, prevRank: number, newRank: number }

title: element​
content: </> type element = { id: number, score: number, tieBreaker: number, extra: {} }?

title: new​
content: </> RankDBClient.new( baseUrl: string,-- The base URL of the RankDB API jwtToken: string?-- Optional JWT token for authentication ) → RankDBClient-- A new RankDBClient instance Creates a new RankDBClient instance.

title: request​
content: </> RankDBClient:request( method: string,-- The HTTP method to use endpoint: string,-- The API endpoint body: table?-- Optional request body ) → table-- The response from the API Sends a request to the RankDB API.

title: createList​
content: </> RankDBClient:createList( listId: string,-- The ID of the list to create set: string?,-- The set to use (default: "default") mergeSize: number?,-- The merge size (default: 500) splitSize: number?,-- The split size (default: 2000) replace: boolean?-- Whether to replace an existing list (default: false) ) → boolean-- True if the list was created, false if it already exists Creates a new list in the RankDB.

title: getListLength​
content: </> RankDBClient:getListLength( listId: string-- The ID of the list ) → number-- The number of elements in the list Gets the length of a list.

title: deleteList​
content: </> RankDBClient:deleteList( listId: string-- The ID of the list to delete ) → boolean-- True if the list was deleted, false if it was not found Deletes a list from the RankDB.

title: getElement​
content: </> RankDBClient:getElement( listId: string,-- The ID of the list elementId: number-- The ID of the element ) → getElementResult-- The element data Gets an element from a list.

title: updateElement​
content: </> RankDBClient:updateElement( listId: string,-- The ID of the list element: element-- The element to update ) → updateElementResult-- The result of the update operation Updates an element in a list.

title: updateMultiElements​
content: </> RankDBClient:updateMultiElements( listId: string,-- The ID of the list elements: {element},-- The elements to update results: boolean?-- Whether to return the results of the update operation (default: true) ) → {updateElementResult}-- The results of the update operation Updates multiple elements in a list. info This method does not return previous rank or score because the API does not support it.

title: deleteElement​
content: </> RankDBClient:deleteElement( listId: string,-- The ID of the list elementId: number-- The ID of the element to delete ) → boolean-- True if the element was deleted, false otherwise Deletes an element from a list.

title: getRankRange​
content: </> RankDBClient:getRankRange( listId: string,-- The ID of the list rank: number,-- Get ranks >= this value limit: number-- The number of elements to retrieve ) → {getElementResult}-- An array of elements in the specified range Gets a range of elements from a list based on rank.

title: _constructElementBodyFromElement​
content: </> RankDBClient:_constructElementBodyFromElement( element: element-- The element to construct the body from ) → table-- The constructed element body Constructs the element body for API requests from an element object.

title: _constructUpdateElementResult​
content: </> RankDBClient:_constructUpdateElementResult( result: table-- The API response ) → updateElementResult-- The constructed update element result Constructs the update element result from the API response.
